00023  * @author Mybrid Spalding

00046 /*****************************************************************************/
00047 /**
00048  * TranslationInputTsvTableModel::TranslationInputTsvTableModel
00049  * Synopsis:
00050  * Main constructor that slurps in the TsvFile and creates the in memory
00051  * version of same said file. Do not use this object if the file is
00052  * too large to fit into main memory, instead see
00053  * TranslationInputStreamTableModel.
00054  *
00055  * There are two callback functions passed in:
00056  * 1.) createDynamicColumnDefinitions, this function takes in the set of
00057  * static columns, or static column schema, already initialized and then
00058  * modifies the schema based on columns in the input file itself.
00059  * Dynamic columns need to be appended to the schem in order for
00060  * enums defined in the super class to work.
00061  *
00062  * 2.) filterRow, this function takes in the row and returns true or
00063  * false. If true is  returned then the row is skipped and
00064  * not appended to the 'm_rows' of data. 
00065  *
00066  * @param rte - the single instance run time environment (obiously not a TranslationInputTsvTableModel) 
00067  * @param inputTsvFileName - the TsvFile object, tab delimited. 
00068  * @param columnDefinitions - the schema for the table
00069  * @param cdSize - the number of columns in the schema (columnDefinitions)
00070  * @param strictTsvColumnOrder  - whether to enforce strict column count and order
00071  * @param createDynamicColumnDefinitions - call back function to append dynamic columns to the static schema where the dynamic columns are taken from input file itself. Primarily implemented for the A1-ANN fields in the translation table file. 
00072  * @param filterRow - callback function applied to each row during the slurp. 
00073  * @param validateColumnRegex - boolean to indicate if validation of the columns should occur. 
00074  *
00075  */
00076 /*****************************************************************************/
00077 TranslationInputTsvTableModel::TranslationInputTsvTableModel(
00078   const RunTimeEnvironment& rte,
00079   const std::string& inputTsvFileName,
00080   const TittmColumnDefinition columnDefinitions[],
00081   size_t cdSize,
00082   bool strictTsvColumnOrder,
00083   bool (*createDynamicColumnDefinitions)(const RunTimeEnvironment & rte, std::vector<TittmColumnDefinition> & columnDefs, const std::string & inputTsvFile), bool (*filterRow)(std::vector< std::string > & row), bool validateColumnRegex) :  m_strictTsvColumnOrder(strictTsvColumnOrder), m_validateColumnRegex(validateColumnRegex)
00084 {
00085 
00086   std::vector< TittmColumnDefinition > columnDefinitions_vec;
00087 
00088   if (createDynamicColumnDefinitions) {
00089     if (!(*createDynamicColumnDefinitions)(rte, columnDefinitions_vec, inputTsvFileName)) {
00090       APT_ERR_ABORT(inputTsvFileName + ": errors detected.");
00091     }
00092     APT_ERR_ASSERT(columnDefinitions_vec.size() > 0, "");
00093   } else {
00094     for (int i = 0; i < cdSize; i++) {
00095       columnDefinitions_vec.push_back(columnDefinitions[i]);
00096     }
00097   }
00098 
00099   _initializeColumnDefinitions(rte, columnDefinitions_vec);
00100 
00101   clearData();
00102 
00103   readTsvFile(rte, inputTsvFileName, filterRow);
00104 
00105 }
00106 // end TranslationInputTsvTableModel::TranslationInputTsvTableModel
00107 /*****************************************************************************/
00108 /*****************************************************************************/
00109 /**
00110  * TranslationInputTsvTableModel::readTsvFile
00111  * Synopsis:
00112  * 
00113  * The part of the main constructor which reads in the TsvFile
00114  * into main memory. Public in case multiple reads are desired.
00115  * The data is read into the 'm_rows" table of std::strings.
00116  *
00117  * When a data error is encournted the file is fully parsed and all
00118  * data errors are reported on before an exception is thrown.
00119  *
00120  * Regular expression validation is supported via the regular expression
00121  * attached to the schema. More involved validation can be accomplished
00122  * via the filterRow callback function. 
00123  *
00124  * @param rte - RunTimeEnvironment
00125  * @param inputTsvFileName - the file in question.
00126  * @param filterRow = callback function, return of true ignores row, see the constructor for details.
00127  */
00128 /*****************************************************************************/
00129 void TranslationInputTsvTableModel::readTsvFile(const RunTimeEnvironment & rte,
00130     const std::string& inputTsvFileName,
00131     bool (*filterRow)(std::vector<std::string> & row))
00132 {
00133 
00134   // This should never happen unless a new constructor is created
00135   // that doesn't initialize columns.
00136   APT_ERR_ASSERT(m_columnDefinition.size(), "");
00137 
00138   clearData();
00139 
00140   TsvFile tsv;
00141 
00142   Verbose::out(ADT_VERBOSE_INPUT_FILES, ToStr("### TranslationInputTsvTableModel::readFile('") + inputTsvFileName + ToStr(")\n"));
00143 
00144 
00145   //
00146   tsv.m_optAutoTrim   = true; // remove '"'s
00147   tsv.m_optQuoteChar1 = 0;    // ignore "'"s
00148   tsv.m_optCheckFormatOnOpen=false; // cause we accept files which have 8bit chars.
00149 
00150   if (tsv.open(inputTsvFileName) != TSV_OK) {
00151     APT_ERR_ABORT(inputTsvFileName + ": failed opening input Tsv file.");
00152   }
00153 
00154   bool okColumnDefinitions = true;
00155 
00156   if (m_strictTsvColumnOrder) {
00157     okColumnDefinitions =
00158       _matchTsvColumnsWithColumnDefinitions(inputTsvFileName, tsv);
00159   }
00160 
00161   if (okColumnDefinitions) {
00162     okColumnDefinitions = _initializeTsvColumns(inputTsvFileName, tsv);
00163   }
00164 
00165   int columnCount = tsv.getColumnCount(0);
00166   bool okColumnValues = true;
00167   int row = 1;
00168   std::string whiteSpace = " ";
00169 
00170   while (okColumnDefinitions && (tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK)) {
00171     //
00172     std::vector<std::string> newRow;
00173     std::string columnValue;
00174     row++;
00175 
00176     newRow.resize(columnCount, "");
00177     bool okRow = true;
00178     for (int tsvColumn = 0; tsvColumn < columnCount; tsvColumn++) {
00179 
00180       std::stringstream lineSStr;
00181       std::string       columnName = getColumnName(m_tsvIndexToColumnDefinitionIndex[tsvColumn]);
00182       // get the data
00183 
00184       if (tsv.get(0, tsvColumn, columnValue) != TSV_OK) {
00185         APT_ERR_ABORT("tsv.get != TSV_OK");
00186       }
00187 
00188       Util::trimString(columnValue, whiteSpace.c_str());
00189 
00190       // empty and allowed?
00191       if (columnValue.empty()) {
00192         if (m_columnDefinition[m_tsvIndexToColumnDefinitionIndex[tsvColumn]].m_emptyOk == false) {
00193           lineSStr << inputTsvFileName << ": ROW " << row  << " : ";
00194           lineSStr << columnName << " : ERROR missing required column.";
00195           Verbose::out(rte.m_currentVerbosity, lineSStr.str());
00196           okColumnValues = false;
00197         }
00198       }
00199       // validate it against regexp
00200       else if (m_validateColumnRegex && !m_columnDefinition[m_tsvIndexToColumnDefinitionIndex[tsvColumn]].m_validRE.FullMatch(columnValue)) {
00201         lineSStr << inputTsvFileName << ": COLUMN [";
00202         lineSStr << tsvColumn << "] " << columnName << " : ERROR invalid value: \"";
00203         lineSStr << columnValue << "\"";
00204         lineSStr << " (expecting " << m_columnDefinition[m_tsvIndexToColumnDefinitionIndex[tsvColumn]].m_validRE.pattern();
00205         lineSStr << ")";
00206         lineSStr << endl;
00207 
00208         for (int j = 0 ; j < columnCount;  j++) {
00209           tsv.get(0, j, columnValue);
00210           lineSStr << columnValue << ",";
00211         }
00212         Verbose::out(rte.m_currentVerbosity, lineSStr.str());
00213         okColumnValues = false;
00214       }
00215       // Ingore row based on data
00216       else if ((m_columnDefinition[m_tsvIndexToColumnDefinitionIndex[tsvColumn]].m_ignoreRE != NULL) &&
00217                (m_columnDefinition[m_tsvIndexToColumnDefinitionIndex[tsvColumn]].m_ignoreRE->PartialMatch(columnValue))) {
00218         okRow = false;
00219 
00220       }
00221       newRow[m_tsvIndexToColumnDefinitionIndex[tsvColumn]] = columnValue;
00222     }
00223 
00224     // Ingore row based on filter
00225     if ((filterRow != NULL) && (*filterRow)(newRow)) {
00226       okRow = false;
00227     }
00228 
00229     // save our row to the data.
00230     if (okRow) {
00231       m_fileRowIndex[m_rows.size()] = row;
00232       m_rows.push_back(newRow);
00233     }
00234   }
00235   //
00236 
00237   tsv.close();
00238 
00239   if (! okColumnDefinitions || ! okColumnValues) {
00240     APT_ERR_ABORT(inputTsvFileName + ": invalid input file or data detected.");
00241   }
00242 
00243 }
00244 // end TranslationInputTsvTableModel::readTsvFile

00247 /**
00248  * TranslationInputTsvTableModel::getColumnName
00249  * Synopsis:
00250  *
00251  * Get the column name from the Transltation Table Tsv File. Used
00252  * for dynamic columns not defined in the static schema.
00253  *
00254  * @param column - the name of the 0 based column index column in question.
00255  */
00256 /*****************************************************************************/
00257 std::string TranslationInputTsvTableModel::getColumnName(int column)
00258 {
00259 
00260   // This should always be true unless some constructor is created
00261   // that doesn't initialize this.
00262   APT_ERR_ASSERT(m_columnDefinition.size(), "");
00263 
00264   APT_ERR_ASSERT((column >= 0) && (column < columnCount()), "");
00265 
00266   return m_columnDefinition[column].m_columnName;
00267 
00268 }
00269 // end TranslationInputTsvTableModel::getColumnName
00270 /*****************************************************************************/
00271 /*****************************************************************************/
00272 /**
00273  * TranslationInputTsvTableModel::getHeaderAsString
00274  * Synopsis:
00275  *
00276  * Debug routine that returns the table schema, header line in the
00277  * TSV file, as a comma (delimiter) separated list.
00278  *
00279  * @param delimiter - comma by default
00280  *
00281  * @return header - the list of column names
00282  */
00283 /*****************************************************************************/
00284 std::string TranslationInputTsvTableModel::getHeaderAsString(const std::string delimiter)  const
00285 {
00286 
00287   std::stringstream headerSStr;
00288 
00289   for (int j = 0 ; j < columnCount(); j++) {
00290     headerSStr << m_columnDefinition[j].m_columnName;
00291 
00292     if (j < (columnCount() - 1)) {
00293       headerSStr << delimiter;
00294     }
00295 
00296   } // for each column
00297 
00298   return headerSStr.str();
00299 
00300 }
00301 // end TranslationInputTsvTableModel::getHeaderAsString
00302 /*****************************************************************************/
00303 /*****************************************************************************/
00304 /**
00305  * TranslationInputTsvTableModel::getHeaderAsVector
00306  * Synopsis:
00307  * 
00308  * Debug conveinance routine that returns the schema as a std::vector of std::strings. 
00309  *
00310  * @return std::vector<std::string> - the column names as a std::vector
00311  */
00312 /*****************************************************************************/
00313 std::vector< std::string >  TranslationInputTsvTableModel::getHeaderAsVector() const
00314 {
00315 
00316   std::vector< std::string > header;
00317 
00318   for (int j = 0 ; j < columnCount(); j++) {
00319     header.push_back(m_columnDefinition[j].m_columnName);
00320   } // for each column
00321 
00322   return header;
00323 
00324 }
00325 // end TranslationInputTsvTableModel::getHeaderAsVector
00326 /*****************************************************************************/
00327 /*****************************************************************************/
00328 /**
00329  * TranslationInputTsvTableModel::getRowAsString
00330  * Synopsis:
00331  * 
00332  * Debug convienance routine that std::stringifies the row. Also used in
00333  * error messages. All columns are "separated" by a single comma (or passed
00334  * in delimiter).
00335  * If the data within a column contains a column there is no attempt made
00336  * quote the columns. Empty columns will have comma sequences as ",,,". 
00337  * column 1 2   3 
00338  * data   A B,C D => "A,B,C,D"
00339  *
00340  * The delimiter option can be used if the data contains commas but another
00341  * delimiter would not, so as to  insure the count of delimiters
00342  * is the column count. 
00343  *
00344  * @param row       - the index into 'm_rows'
00345  * @param delimiter - comma by default.
00346  *
00347  * @return std::string - the comma (delimiter) separated std::string
00348  */
00349 /*****************************************************************************/
00350 std::string TranslationInputTsvTableModel::getRowAsString(const int row, const std::string delimiter)  const
00351 {
00352 
00353   APT_ERR_ASSERT((row >= 0) && (row < size()), "");
00354 
00355   std::stringstream rowSStr;
00356 
00357   for (int j = 0 ; j < columnCount(); j++) {
00358     rowSStr << m_rows[row][j];
00359 
00360     if (j < (columnCount() - 1)) {
00361       rowSStr << delimiter;
00362     }
00363 
00364   } // for each column
00365 
00366   return rowSStr.str();
00367 
00368 }
00369 // end TranslationInputTsvTableModel::getRowAsString

00372 /**
00373  * TranslationInputTsvTableModel::columnCount
00374  * Synopsis:
00375  * 
00376  * Interogate an already instantiated table for the number of columns.
00377  * This method assumes ALL rows have the same column width and just
00378  * returns the width of the column defintion structure. .
00379  *
00380  * @return - the number of columns in a row. 
00381  */
00382 /*****************************************************************************/
00383 int TranslationInputTsvTableModel::columnCount() const
00384 {
00385 
00386   if (m_columnDefinition.size()  > 0) {
00387     return m_columnDefinition.size();
00388   }
00389 
00390   return 0;
00391 
00392 }
00393 // end TranslationInputTsvTableModel::columnCount

00396 /**
00397  * TranslationInputTsvTableModel::_initializeColumnDefinitions
00398  * Synopsis:
00399  * Helper function to the constructor,
00400  * TranslationInputTsvTableModel::TranslationInputTsvTableModel
00401  *
00402  * Initialize the definition of columns data structure. This is compared
00403  * against the input TSV file when it is opened for integrity. 
00404  *
00405  * @param rte - the single instance RunTimeEnvironment
00406  * @param columnDefinitions - the table schema 
00407  *
00408  */
00409 /*****************************************************************************/
00410 void TranslationInputTsvTableModel::_initializeColumnDefinitions(const RunTimeEnvironment & rte, const std::vector< TittmColumnDefinition> columnDefinitions)
00411 {
00412 
00413   APT_ERR_ASSERT(columnDefinitions.size() > 0, "");
00414 
00415   m_columnDefinition.clear();
00416 
00417   // Iterate so we can doublecheck the m_index value.
00418   for (int i = 0; i < columnDefinitions.size(); i++) {
00419 
00420     // Ok, columnDefintions are created at compile time
00421     // and are NOT dynamic at run-time, therefore we assert to the following
00422     // is true.
00423 
00424     APT_ERR_ASSERT(columnDefinitions[i].m_index == i, "");
00425 
00426     m_columnNameIndex[columnDefinitions[i].m_columnName] = i;
00427     m_columnDefinition.push_back(columnDefinitions[i]);
00428   }
00429 
00430   return;
00431 }
00432 // end TranslationInputTsvTableModel::_initializeColumnDefinitions
00433 /*****************************************************************************/
00434 /*****************************************************************************/
00435 /**
00436  * TranslationInputTsvTableModel::_initializeTsvColumns
00437  * Synopsis:
00438  *
00439  * Helper function to TranslationInputTsvTableModel::readTsvFile
00440  *
00441  * Initialize the TsvFile object columns from the column definitions
00442  * and validate against the table schema. 
00443  *
00444  * @param inputTsvFileName - The name of the TsvFile in question.
00445  * @param tsv              - The TsvFile object in question.
00446  *
00447  * @return false - on error.
00448  *
00449  */
00450 /*****************************************************************************/
00451 bool TranslationInputTsvTableModel::_initializeTsvColumns(const std::string & inputTsvFileName, affx::TsvFile & tsv)
00452 {
00453 
00454   bool         okTsvColumns = true;
00455   std::stringstream msgSStr;
00456 
00457   m_tsvIndexToColumnDefinitionIndex.resize(tsv.getColumnCount(0), -1);
00458 
00459 
00460   for (int column = 0; column < m_columnDefinition.size(); column++) {
00461 
00462     // find the tsv column index for this
00463     int tsvColumn
00464     = tsv.cname2cidx(0, m_columnDefinition[column].m_columnName);
00465 
00466     if (tsvColumn < 0) {
00467       okTsvColumns = false;
00468       msgSStr << inputTsvFileName << ": invalid TsvFile header first-line, ";
00469       msgSStr << "column [" << (column + 1) << "], \"";
00470       msgSStr << m_columnDefinition[column].m_columnName << "\"  not found." << endl;
00471       continue;
00472     }
00473 
00474     m_tsvIndexToColumnDefinitionIndex[tsvColumn]
00475     = m_columnDefinition[column].m_index;
00476 
00477   }
00478 
00479   if (!okTsvColumns) {
00480     Verbose::out(ADT_VERBOSE_NORMAL, msgSStr.str(), false);
00481   }
00482 
00483   return okTsvColumns;
00484 
00485 }
00486 // end TranslationInputTsvTableModel::_initializeTsvColumns
00487 /*****************************************************************************/
00488 /*****************************************************************************/
00489 /**
00490  * TranslationInputTsvTableModel::_matchTsvColumnsWithColumnDefinitions
00491  * Synopsis:
00492  *
00493  * Helper function to TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_openTsvFile
00494  *
00495  * It is not normal Affymetrix practice to require to have only the
00496  * set of columns required nor is it normal practice to have those
00497  * columns in any order. The TsvFile object can access columns by
00498  * name independent of order. However, there exists requirements
00499  * for this application to enforce column order as well as column order
00500  * enforce only columns diseried.
00501  * 
00502  * This helper is used to enforce strict column ordering when required.
00503  * Inspect the first line of the TsvFile and insure the appropriate header
00504  * column names exist one-to-one and in the same order
00505  * with all the column definitions. Note this is only required for certain
00506  * files such as the human generated TranslationTable.xls spreadsheet.
00507  *
00508  * @param inputTsvFileName - the Tsv file in question
00509  * @param tsv - the TsvFile object that is opened and corresponds to
00510  *              inputTsvFileName
00511  *
00512  * @return false - the header line is invalid.
00513  */
00514 /*****************************************************************************/
00515 bool TranslationInputTsvTableModel::_matchTsvColumnsWithColumnDefinitions(const std::string & inputTsvFileName, affx::TsvFile & tsv)
00516 {
00517 
00518   bool okHeaderLine = true;
00519 
00520   int invalidHeaderCount = 0;
00521 
00522   std::stringstream msgSStr;
00523 
00524   for (int i = 0; (i < tsv.getColumnCount(0)) &&
00525        (i < m_columnDefinition.size()) ; i++) {
00526 
00527     std::string columnName;
00528 
00529     if (tsv.cidx2cname(0, i, columnName) == TSV_OK) {
00530 
00531       pcrecpp::RE columnRE(m_columnDefinition[i].m_columnName);
00532 
00533       if (! columnRE.FullMatch(columnName)) {
00534         okHeaderLine = false;
00535         msgSStr << inputTsvFileName << ": invalid TsvFile header first-line, ";
00536         msgSStr << "column [" << (i + 1) << "]: found \"" << columnName << "\" but was expecting \"";
00537         msgSStr << m_columnDefinition[i].m_columnName << "\"." << endl;
00538         invalidHeaderCount++;
00539       }
00540     } else {
00541 
00542       APT_ERR_ABORT("tsv.cidx2cname returned unexpected error");
00543 
00544     } // if there was a TSV_ERROR
00545 
00546   } // for each column, inspect it
00547 
00548   if (invalidHeaderCount > 0) {
00549     if (invalidHeaderCount < 4 || true) {
00550       Verbose::out(ADT_VERBOSE_NORMAL, msgSStr.str(), false);
00551     } else {
00552       Verbose::out(ADT_VERBOSE_NORMAL, inputTsvFileName + ": invalid TsvFile is missing the header line.", false);
00553     }
00554   }
00555 
00556   return okHeaderLine;
00557 
00558 }
00559 // end TranslationInputTsvTableModel::_matchTsvColumnsWithColumnDefinitions
00560 /*****************************************************************************/
